title: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description: Sometimes, the server's CPU usage reaches 100% and stays at 100% until the server is restarted. This issue has been reproduced with Java versions 1.6.007, 1.6.018, and 1.6.021. It seems to be a duplicate of Bug 46373, which the Jetty team has fixed. Logging added to NioEndpoint.java shows that sometimes selector.select(timeout) returns zero keys on Linux platform.
OB: The logging reveals that selector.select(timeout) sometimes returns zero keys on Linux platform.
EB: To reproduce the JVM bug, multiple requests should be made to the web application (e.g., by pressing F5 in the browser and holding the button).
